intro: Indigofera cognata, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, bright red flowers that resemble the pimpernel plant. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Indigofera cognata is often found in woodland edges, thickets, and along stream banks.
